arm_group.description: Sedation with midazolam and analgesia with fentanyl
Laryngeal plus supraglottic plus intratracheal nerve block plus sedation with midazolam

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare intubation with nerve block with intubation with
      sedation in awake patients in terms of efficacy, ease, and the rate of complications and
      physician satisfaction

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Intubation With Nerve Block and With Sedation in Awake Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Candidate for intubation with methods other than RSI

          -  Age>= 18 years

          -  Patient or patient's guardian's consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Need for RSI or crash intubation

          -  Allergy to Lidocain in block group

          -  Allergy to opioid drugs in sedation group

          -  Allergy to midazolam in either group

intervention.description: Lidocain 2% topical injection, 0.5 - 1 cc Lidocain 4% topical injection, 3 cc Lidocain 10% topical spray , total dose 50 mg

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of in Intubation With Nerve Block and Intubation With Sedation in Awake Patients in Terms of Efficacy, Complications and Physician's Satisfaction

primary_outcome.description: The interval is measured from the time that the healthcare provider attempts intubation until a successful intubation is achieved.
primary_outcome.measure: Time required for intubation in seconds
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of the intubation attempt for an average of one minutes

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Physicians' perception about the difficulty of the procedure is assessed using a 5-point Likert type scale (ranging from very easy to very difficult)verbally administered to the healthcare provider immediately (within 30 minutes) after completion of the intubation
secondary_outcome.measure: physicians' perception of the difficulty of the procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within an average of 30 minutes after completion of the procedure

secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients developing any of the following complications (cough, esophageal intubation) from the start of the procedure until 30 minutes after completion of the procedure. This will represent the rate of complications
secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of the procedure until 30 minutes after the procedure is completed

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
